description: Unique primary key for this settings record.
Timestamp when localization or language resources for the application were last updated; likely specific to multilingual content - confirm with SME.
Database build number corresponding to the deployed application release, used to manage compatibility and upgrades.
Timestamp when any application setting in this record was last changed.
Placeholder CLOB field used to store a sentinel when no text applies; likely legacy/system artifact - confirm with SME.
Identifier for the company, tenant, or corporate entity these settings apply to.
Boolean flag indicating whether the deployment uses a split or multi-database configuration (e.g., separating data/configuration).
Version of the import framework or data schema expected by the system, used to validate import compatibility.
Encoded set of global configuration flags (likely bitmask or code) controlling optional behaviors; exact meanings defined by application - confirm with SME.
Flag to enable tracking of asset or record state changes across the system; likely a feature toggle - confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether auditing of changes (who/when) is enabled across the application.
Incremental database schema revision number used for patching and migration control.
Indicates whether FIPS-validated cryptography is enforced for security-sensitive operations.
Indicates whether FIPS mode has been initialized/configured in this environment.
User identifier for who created this settings record.
Timestamp when this settings record was created.
User identifier for who last modified this settings record.
Timestamp when this settings record was last modified.
